website_summaries.verdict: Whether trekking over groomed snow or exploring off-the-beaten-path terrain, these snowshoes may be the only pair you need. Purchasing the flotation tails are worth it if you need them.
pros: Sturdy construction that includes easy-to-adjust bindings and grippy carbon steel crampons
Can handle tough wintry conditions, long hikes, and uneven trails and inclines
Decent to walk in, as they aren't bulky or extremely heavy
cons: Flotation tails may be needed in deep, powdery snow, and for heavier wearers or those with larger feet (they must be purchased separately)
Bindings may loosen, especially in very cold temps

customer_reviews.title: Great Gear, Quick set-up, Faultless in use!
customer_reviews.text: Around the Olympic National Forest these are used as the main rentals. They are almost bulletproof, figuratively speaking. The straps will wear, and could eventually break, but as with all Great Gear, they are Easily (and relatively inexpensively) replaced. Was able to traverse steep terrain in very deep powder conditions, hike comfortably for a few hours, and even gracefully glissade the descent. Love these snowshoes and the fact that you can put floats on them, though they performed well enough without to not warrant need for them! Also they Seem Indestructible, so far GREAT product and I don't think my mind will be changing any time soon!
customer_reviews.author: GHR

customer_reviews.title: MSR EVO 22
customer_reviews.text: After trying 3 other pairs of snowshoes I opted to get this better pair. Size is great, I’m 5’3”. All reviews seemed to be happy with them and I was not disappointed. No more struggles with straps or buckles. No more clicking sounds while shoeing. Easy to manuveur as I broke trail a few times. No slipping down steep grades. I am pleased with these and have already recommended them to 2 friends who are also frustrated with old straps and shoes.
customer_reviews.author: retiringtoNH

customer_reviews.title: Really great for snowshoeing in places that are groomed
customer_reviews.text: Really great for snowshoeing in places that are groomed. I live on an island so I am limited to the local golf course and the few trails that are accessible. If there is a lot of snow, I find snowmobile or cross country tracks and follow them since I did not purchase the tails. If you want to snowshoe off the beaten track, you definitely need tails, but if you are mostly snowshoeing for exercise or walking the dog I would definitely recommend them as they are super light and great for long distances.
customer_reviews.author: MB-Maine

customer_reviews.title: Be forewarned .... straps break and very poor warranty
customer_reviews.text: Bought 9 months ago...of this time span about 3 months suitable for snowshoeing, therefore have used sparingly. Heal strap broke today on one of the snowshoes ... the other strap also about ready to break on other shoe. Called their customer service to see if they would send another rubber heal strap...no way. Was told that if you buy the snowshoes and they have a factory defect ... they will fix it. In my mind, if straps are breaking this quickly... that is a factory defect. With warranty like this, I will not buy anymore products from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these snowshoes. Last winter I used them weekly with all the snow in New England. Have also owned a pair of Tubbs for years. These are much lighter and the bindings are significantly easier to operate. Also purchased the Evo Tail extensions. Makes a great combination.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Loving these - add the tails for epic versatility!
customer_reviews.text: I use the Evo snowshoes for work - I've wanted them for years, but working in deep snow solidified the purchase. These are tank-like in their efficiency and ease of putting on/taking off. The tails make the snowshoes so versatile that I would recommend them to anyone. I'm using these for 3+ foot deep powder and digging snow pits. If I'm in a tight pit I can just take the tails off and keep the crampon-like traction while saving maneuverability. So far no mechanical failure other than a broken retaining clip (they should give you extras).
customer_reviews.author: C. Guiles

customer_reviews.title: Wicked simple and they work well
customer_reviews.text: They fit a size 11mens winter boot fine. They sunk into the snow a bit deeper then I expected. One of my friends thought the same. I weigh under 160lbs so I’m with in weight. My test on these was a hike up a 4000ft mountain in the whites on varied surfaces and they held up. For straight ice on a incline or decline I’d rather microspikes. But if your slow and careful you won’t need to remove them. Only used them 3 times so hard to say for durability, but I have friends who swear by them. I am quite happy.
customer_reviews.author: 0utd00r Wand3r3r

customer_reviews.title: he would recommend getting the extensions for them but all in all ...
customer_reviews.text: i got these as a gift for my husband and he loves them. he is 350 and had gear on and stayed with a cross country skier on a downhill trek without a problem in 4 1/2 feet of snow. he says he highly recommends them they are worth the price. he would recommend getting the extensions for them but all in all they are great
customer_reviews.author: melina

customer_reviews.title: I love these snowshoes for that easy winter trek
customer_reviews.text: I love these snowshoes for that easy winter trek. The foot rocker works great for that snow walk across easy terrain as well as deeper off trail adventures. I paired them with the Evo Tails to give me a wider access of terrain. The strapping system is easy and quick fastening. I would like to see a slightly longer clip apparatus but once I figured out the order of buckling, they slipped on easily and held well.
customer_reviews.author: Lois DePiesse

customer_reviews.title: Ready for Snow!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, it hasn't snowed yet this year, and I'm not praying for it either! But as soon as it does, I'll be ready! I ordered these on a lightning deal & since they arrived, have tried them on with my boots & they are a perfect fit. Easy to adjust. They have great traction on the bottom of these, I can tell they won't be sliding anywhere! Seem very durable & high quality. Can't wait to get them outside, but won't complain if it's not for a while ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Cats Cuddles

customer_reviews.title: These are SO cool, SO fun, and a perfect purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I'd never been snowshoeing before I bought these, and now I'm totally hooked! These are so much fun to wear, the traction is fantastic, and once you figure out how to put them on and buckle them, (and it takes a minute if you're not familiar with these particular buckles) they're really easy to put on and take off. Love. Love. Love them, and I'm currently scanning the weather forecast, with fingers crossed for more snow!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Very light for light backpacking. Attaches to pack with many option places to clamp shoes to pack.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to put on. Nice gripping with the toe crampon as well as the side gripping rails. Used them this week on the trail with ice and snow. Great traction on the accent and decent. A little noisier than the traditional tubular snowshoes but the lateral traction is better with the MSRs Evos.
customer_reviews.author: Vicsky

customer_reviews.title: Have used them a lot, and am very happy with them.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in winter of 2018 for moderate snow shoeing outside of Denver. They're terrific. Easy to put on. Give a little with the straps when I hit an unseen object. Great gripping before/after powder season. So far no damaged or worn parts, and I've used them A LOT. I've had them out in as much as 3' of powder. I usually do 1500-2500 ft of vertical when I shoe. Fairly aggressive. They were recommended to me by two separate shoe-ers. I'm glad I took their advice. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: T. S. Sparks

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I just climbed a peek with these last weekend, a day after I received them. I put them on and started hiking. I didn't even need to stop once to adjust the straps (big difference from my old ones that are like boats). They are super light, comfortable, and have great traction. I am going to order the tails! Winter - I am ready for you! :-)
customer_reviews.author: vivie

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: These snow shoes side hill much better than tubular snowshoes due to the extra metal runners on the sides. They are a bit heavier & a little wider than my previous shoes but once I got used to them I found them to be a much more versitle snowshoe, I could hike much steeper terrain with them. I'm a light weight at 120 so even in powder I did not need the tails. I'm very pleased with this purchase. I pretty much use these shoes everyday to take my four dogs on their evening hike.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Terrific snowshoes!
customer_reviews.text: A huge improvement over my old ones. Easy to put on, to take off, and they stay in place through miles and miles of trekking. You'd probably need the tails if you were carrying a heavy pack, but for day use, no tails needed, even in pretty deep snow.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: Not great for people over 180lbs in powder snow.
customer_reviews.text: These are better than being ball deep in snow, but if you’re over 180lbs and in Midwest powder just spend the extra and get the 25” MSR revo. I returned these as they sank more in powder than I liked, but they were better than nothing too.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Tanner

customer_reviews.title: These worked great on snowmobile trails.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get in, floats well, tails make them better. Great grip. The seemed a little noisy but I have nothing to judge that off other than others opinion and my singular experience with these. Great value, but Probably not for deep powder.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Reliable simple rugged snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the charcoal color nothing to really dislike rugged, tripped over my own snowshoes simple to use equipment, dh & cc skier first time snowshoeing fs 4832 lk kachess rd had a blast 5-5 150lbs no problem in deep snow small pack with water lunch snacks
customer_reviews.author: Kitcheninja

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never had snowshoes before so nothing to compare to. The buckles seemed confusing at first but once we tried them a few times, it made sense. Very comfortable. We bought them for a trip to the mountains. Did two 5-mile hikes on mostly packed and crunchy snow. These snowshoes are awesome!! Just strap them on and go anywhere!! Great support (even wo the sold separately tails). Excellent traction up and down hills.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Great looking and great performance on medium depth snow or ...
customer_reviews.text: Great looking and great performance on medium depth snow or packed snow. Not so good in very deep loose snow. The decal graphic at the back debonded on the first day :(
customer_reviews.author: Marc-Antoine Delarche

customer_reviews.title: I will say they scruff/catch pretty easy at the front
customer_reviews.text: These work really well and the amazon price seems to be the standard price out there for these snowshoes. These work well for those that are just getting in to snowshoeing. They work well for my boyfriend who isn't used to walking with his feet far apart from one another. I will say they scruff/catch pretty easy at the front. You also really have to make sure your foot is in the correct position (ie ball of foot on the spot that designates that). I have no complaints but haven't used these in really deep, powdery snow. If you are not sure of the appropriate snowshoes to choose I suggesting looking at the MSR website.
customer_reviews.author: JennyfromBoston

customer_reviews.title: Great all around snowshoe.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent snowshoes. Very durable with an easy secure boot clamp. Traction is superior. Added tails give more lift. I've used these for several years and purchased again for family members' Christmas. MSR is made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great value for great snowshoes.
customer_reviews.text: I love these snowshoes. Very easy to put on and great in the snow. I didn't slip one time.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Appreciated gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my grandsons living in Colorado. They sent me pictures of the fun they were having hiking in the snow in the upper Rockies. They thanked me for “best gift ever” and commented on how lightweight yet effective they were
customer_reviews.author: B_Stro

customer_reviews.title: Great traction
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband, and he has absolutely loved them. Says they have great traction on steep hills. He's gone out several times and used them on long-distance trails and likes how light and easy they are. They're not so bulky and clumsy as others we've used.
customer_reviews.author: C.Stastny Books

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace some older ones. The new features are fantastic! The bindings are much easier to use than the old Denali's, especially if you have gloves on. These taper a bit as well, which make it easier for walking. These are great for steep inclines as well, no slipping!
customer_reviews.author: John Alleman

customer_reviews.title: Hello Snow Shoe-ing.
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but... it's the only item on the market that I have found to be confident in snowy terrain. Plus... it's not like they're going to wear out. Downside- you have to buy two or you're always going to go by yourself. Other's can't keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Shops Online

customer_reviews.title: great for a smaller individual
customer_reviews.text: light weight compared to larger shoes. Great for a smaller person, 120 lb person floats easily without the tails. At 230 I can feel the difference between these and larger snow shoes. They are lighter than my shoes, but also don't provide enough flotation. I would love to try the tails on these, but don't want to spend the extra cash just to try them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Great quality which is to me expected from a company like MSR and at this price point!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, solid, and fun!
customer_reviews.text: These are AMAZING! I took then up Mt. Rose and up Castle Peak (both steep and above 9,000', 7-11 miles and around 2,000' elevation gain) and these babies where solid! I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Hodges

customer_reviews.title: can't wait for it to snow so I can see if they kick up a lot like my traditional wooden bear paws
customer_reviews.text: Heavy enough for serious trekking, can't wait for it to snow so I can see if they kick up a lot like my traditional wooden bear paws. Bindings easy to use with gloves
customer_reviews.author: MR. B

customer_reviews.title: MSR.. the most trusted name in snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: Best design.. dont know how other shoe mnfrs are still in business. Tried many, but nothing offers the stability, traction and durability of MSR.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roland

customer_reviews.title: I can actually walk on 7 inches snow with no problem
customer_reviews.text: I took it to snow and it really wotked for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen H.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a variety of users
customer_reviews.text: Great snowshoes for the average user. I'm a 5'6 female at about 125 lbs and while I could have gotten smaller ones, I ordered these so visitors could use them also. I use them on hikes with the dog and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Super light and durable a great snow shoe for beginner or advanced, made for flat to rolling terrain with some steeper hills.
customer_reviews.author: T.J. F.

customer_reviews.title: so I feel confident they are a good product. Love the fun color
customer_reviews.text: I've used these a few times now. They are a little different from the ones I had, so still getting use to them. I bought a pair of this brand for my husband a few years ago, so I feel confident they are a good product. Love the fun color.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but I find the straps don't stay ...
customer_reviews.text: Good price, but I find the straps don't stay hooked in place, and tend to flap around when they come out of their clips
customer_reviews.author: MEC

customer_reviews.title: MSR win
customer_reviews.text: These snowshoes are great! I highly recommend them for all snow goers. They are expensive, but you get what you pay for. I have an older pair of MSR's that I've had for 6 years and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Wilkstar Woods

customer_reviews.title: Very basic, gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Fine product, but without a riser and needing extensions for anything deep or if you are even slightly above average in weight means it's pretty limited in its ability. Fine starter shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Slavkin

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome snow shoes for the beginner great floatation must have if out doors person
customer_reviews.author: swdizzy

customer_reviews.title: Love the color
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight , straps are kinda odd , perfect in deep snow
customer_reviews.author: jamazing

customer_reviews.title: returned
customer_reviews.text: I returned this pair, but kept another one just like it in another color.
customer_reviews.author: jean

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very light, well built and fast. The prominent crampons grip well and the binding is secure. I'm 6' 200lbs and have no issues with floatation. MSR makes solid stuff that they are willing to stand behind.
customer_reviews.author: JTS

customer_reviews.title: great snowshoes with accessory tails in deep
customer_reviews.text: Works, I weight 230lbs, great snowshoes with accessory tails in deep snow
customer_reviews.author: Russell Welch

customer_reviews.title: Decent snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: These are great snow shoes my only complaint is if you’re on rigid snow they are really loud with the plastic frame
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, fit perfectly
customer_reviews.text: My son loves the snow shoes. He actually hiked Mount Elbert, two days after Christmas. They are light, comfortable, fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ines Becerra

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for my son
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on a wonderful product! I upgraded my son's MSR Tyker shoes to this after an incredible growth spurt
customer_reviews.author: Hung Lo

customer_reviews.title: but I did my homework and was very pleased with the MSR Evo 22
customer_reviews.text: I'm just getting into snowshoeing, but I did my homework and was very pleased with the MSR Evo 22. I purchased the tails separately and I've had a great winter out in the woods. Very stable and I like the small shoe when the snow is packed with the option to add the tail for deep powder.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Makes me want to get outside more!
customer_reviews.text: My new passion in new snow. These are great and so easy to put on. Very light, sturdy and have excellent mobility. They are much better handling than other types of snowshoes I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE so light on the foot and I can ...
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE so light on the foot and I can scale up or down any snow sided hill without a slip and fall! WORTH it
customer_reviews.author: Amy Calkins

customer_reviews.title: These are great snowshoes, I have loved them
customer_reviews.text: 4 1/2 stars. These are great snowshoes, I have loved them. The straps are just a little difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Feller

customer_reviews.title: These are great and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are great and sturdy. Purchased for $99 best price. Do not buy cheaper snowshoes which are made of aluminum since after two seasons they started bending.
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: My son bought these because he is heading to college in Bought Michigan. He has not yet tried them.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Buckner

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I have used these while exercising our dogs. I appreciate how well they grip on sidehills and slopes. They are easy to adjust. I have not had any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful and make me feel like I am walking on ...
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful and make me feel like I am walking on air. The recommendations from everyone were correct.
customer_reviews.author: Tamstergirl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect trail snowshoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight, easy to put on and adjust, and great fun on crunchy snow! Quick delivery and well- packaged
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes! They replaced my more traditional Atlas pair ...
customer_reviews.text: Great snowshoes! They replaced my more traditional Atlas pair and I much prefer the bindings and crampons on the MSR.
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty good snow shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like how well they grip, but the straps don’t latch down so sometimes they slide off.
customer_reviews.author: Doing stuff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: Great snowshoes very light easy to put on and tough very well made
customer_reviews.author: Mike podner

customer_reviews.title: So glad I purchased these snow shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful snow shoes. They are extremely light weigh, they are super easy to put on and they look good too!
customer_reviews.author: birdly girl

customer_reviews.title: Bring on the snow!
customer_reviews.text: Just buy them. Best entry level shoe you can get for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: have snow shoes will travel
customer_reviews.text: I can go anywhere with these and have. The woods that extend below my property haven't been travelled by anyone except deer and bears for 40 years. Lots of valleys and steep slopes and these are perfect for this kind of bushwacking. We had a few big storms after I got them, so I gave them a good workout...very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: phil morse

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these snowshoes! They are light weight, very easy to adjust and comfortable to walk with.
customer_reviews.author: anna moore

customer_reviews.title: Greta Product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best snowshoe I hoverer owned! We went for a hike at an ice cave this past Winter, and I was the *only* person who did not slip and slide over the ice! Each step was assured, and the snowy trail to and from the ice cave was also a treat!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: They're light weigt, keep you above the snow, and give you good traction. I also bought the tails which make the placement of the weight on the snowshoes a little awkward, but I like how small they become when you take the tail off.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: They slip off too easily.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, but the strap system just simply does not work at all for me. They are constantly slipping off my feet. I understand how to strap them on, you have to hook the metal catch through the hole, but it doesn't matter, they still just pop up for me. I don't understand why some shoes have this style of strapping. They should all be a ratcheting system or buckle system where they cannot come off while you are walking.
customer_reviews.author: Draconna

customer_reviews.title: Great value for lightweight, packable shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are the standard for inexpensive, lightweight, packable snowshoes. I recently did a light & fast approach to a mountaineering objective and covered 2 miles of fresh powder and mixed ice in these. I have previously used another pair of identical MSRs on steep terrain and they climb very well on loose powder due to their small size and light weight. They are excellent if you're also light (I'm probably 190 with pack and gear), but you may sink if you weigh more and aren't using the tails. They articulate very well and the strap mechanisms are easy to use once they are properly adjusted for your boots.
customer_reviews.author: howunlikely

customer_reviews.title: Great snowshoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are great snowshoes.... very,very durable, easy to put on and take off, and they keep my wife (@120 lbs.) on top of the powder. They also get really good traction on the icy snow and keep her from slipping! Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Walling

customer_reviews.title: They worked fantastic! Bindings were quick to adjust and they kept ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought them and immediately went on a 5 mile snowshoe hike with my son. They worked fantastic! Bindings were quick to adjust and they kept me right on top of the snow. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: T. Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Field test-blizzard of 2016
customer_reviews.text: Blizzard of 2016. Walked Saturday without snowshoes in about 20" of snow. Went as you might expect. Tough slog. Snow pushed inside of pant leg and over tops of boots. Very tiring. Sunday walked with MSR Evo's for the first time in about 28" of snow. Much better although needed the tails which I did not purchase. Minimal snow inside of pant leg. Straps stayed buckled throughout. Covered more ground than previous walk by far, although still not a walk in the park. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: With the extensions these work great in Pacific North west snow
customer_reviews.text: I am 210lbs carrying a 40 lb pack. With the extensions these work great in Pacific North west snow!
customer_reviews.author: jake barlass

customer_reviews.title: I like them, my husband, not so much.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these snow shoes - I have used them now 4 times and they are very easy to use. It was tricky at first to get use to the bindings and get them tight enough, but once I took the time to figure out how to do them right, they were on for the whole hike. My husband also used them to play with the kids in the 4 feet of snow in the yard, but he was in a rush and didn't do the bindings tight enough, so they fell off. He wasn't a fan of them because of the bindings, but I don't mind them.
customer_reviews.author: Charfish

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Light and easy to put on and off. They also stay on whichbis important. I do recommend getting the bag for traveling purposes, I was able to use it to also store my microspikes.
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: But I think I got a good product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't use these yet. But I think I got a good product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: bloal

customer_reviews.title: Colorado. 10,000 ft
customer_reviews.text: Colorado. 10,000 ft. windy. took me so long to put on bindings that my group had gone on without me. These bindings work kinda in warm air, but become hard in the cold where you use them and you cant easily put on with gloves on
customer_reviews.author: drummer man

customer_reviews.title: Good Snowshoe for the recreational adventurer.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. This is my first pair of snowshoes that I owned, I had rented previously. This shoe is very light and the grabs the ice wonderfully. I am 6' and 205 lbs and carry a 2 yr old on my back so I elected to purchase the extension tails for when the snow is deep. The shoe is easy put on and even easier to take off. The straps seem to be industrial and strong. I have only worn these 3 times so they still need to be tested for longevity. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A MSR disappointment. Bridal when cold
customer_reviews.text: A absolute piece of junk! Failed miserably at what was advertised as its capabilities and function. Description of product and its features were inaccurate and deceptive or in many cases incomplete.
customer_reviews.author: ViewFinder

customer_reviews.title: Got a pair of these and am in love. I spend my weekends tromping through the fresh ...
customer_reviews.text: Live in Utah and I hike a ton in the summer but trying to stay in shape in the winter. Got a pair of these and am in love. I spend my weekends tromping through the fresh powder of Utah. These are solid and easy to use. At first it seems like the straps could have a way of coming off but that is before you realize the action of hiking keeps the straps tight. I am going to buy another pair for my wife and highly recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Drew Jackson

product_meta.title: MSR Evo Trail 22-Inch Hiking Snowshoes
product_meta.description: The MSR Evo Trail Hiking Snowshoe is a favorite of snowshoers around the world, offering exceptional value for trail walking and all-condition day use. Known for dependability and durablity, these 22-inch snowshoes provide excellent traction and floatation on snowy trails and rolling terrain. The steel traction rails and brake bars are molded directly into the snowshoe decking, and along with carbon steel crampons, provide secure grip in varied conditions, from ice and crust to packed powder. DuoFit bindings deliver weather-resistant, glove-friendly, adjustable attachment to a variety of footwear. For extra floatation in deep snow, optional 6-inch modular floatation tails (sold separately) can be attached to snowshoes. An ideal choice for both men and women looking for an all-purpose snowshoe, the MSR Evo Trail measures 8 x 22 inches, weighs 3.56 pounds, and can carry a 180-pound load (body weight plus gear); bindings fit men’s shoes sizes 4.5-15. Sold as a pair. Made in the USA. Manufacturer’s three-year limited warranty.
feature_bullets: Dependable, durable all-condition snowshoes offer excellent traction and floatation on snowy trails and rolling terrain
Steel traction rails and brake bars are molded into snowshoe decking, and along with carbon steel crampons, provide secure grip in tricky conditions
DuoFit bindings deliver freeze-proof, glove-friendly, adjustable attachment to a wide range of footwear
Optional 6-inch modular floatation tails (sold separately) provide extra floatation in deep powder
Snowshoes measure 8 x 22 inches, weigh 3.56 pounds, and can carry a 180-pound load; bindings fit men’s shoes sizes 4.5-15; made in the USA
